data.title: My Favorite Unexpected 90s Movie Plot Twists
data.meta_description: Plot twists can make a film great, or can cause a movie to bomb. Discover some of the best twist endings of 90s cinema and the resonance they still hold.
data.text:
Warning: Mild Spoilers of 30-year-old movies ahead

My arm hairs rose to attention, a tingle ran down my spine. “Oh!” I whispered in shock and nudged my boyfriend’s shoulder.

“Wow. I seriously can’t believe I didn’t catch that earlier,” he whispered back.

I sat back in my seat and marveled at the theater screen. M. Night Shyamalan then rose to cinematic genius levels in my impressionable young film student mind. The Bruce Willis reveal in The Sixth Sense may be comfortably familiar now, but when the movie debuted in theaters back in ancient times (1999), the first wave of theatergoers didn’t see it coming.

In the 1990s, plot twists and twist endings weren’t new cinematic storytelling devices. Over 100 years ago, in 1920, a German, black and white horror film, The Cabinet of Dr. Caligari wowed audiences with its brilliant, silent twist ending long before the first “talkie” ever hit the screen.

Yet I figured out many of the twist endings I’d viewed in theaters long before their reveal. Poor or forced plot twists in the third act cheapened the viewing experience for me … until an onslaught of 90s films kept me…
